SENT.plain: Arterial and venous pressures have been measured in the cortical circulation of baboons
Arterial perfusion pressure was found to be relatively lower in hypercapnia than in normocapnia, while venous pressure was higher in hypercapnia than normocapnia
In hypercapnia, during middle cerebral occlusion, the arteriovenous pressure differences virtually disappeared and evidence of collateral inflow to the ischaemic zone was absent
Reactive hyperaemia after middle cerebral occlusion was reduced or abolished in hypercapnia
The significance of these findings in relation to treatment of ischaemic vascular disease with CO(2) is discussed
